name: Holiday Inn Washington DC / Greenbelt MD

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights on a trip to DC with a friend. The hotel is in a good location, less than a mile off the highway and close to a HUGE shopping center.
reviews.title: Decent Holiday Inn. Would stay here again. Good value!

reviews.text: Upon entering there is a nice lobby with free coffee. The front desk staff was very friendly helpful and accommodating for the duration of the trip.
reviews.title: There was a BONE on the floor!

reviews.text: The room was average sized, clean, nicely furnished with a 37'' TV, a recliner, dresser, desk and computer chair. For a hotel the room was very well lit and had an abundance of easily accessible electrical outlets. The beds and pillows were just ok (certainly not uncomfortable, but I've had much better). The room also has a microwave and refrigerator which is always nice. My biggest complaint would have to be the AC. It was a very old fashioned unit which essentially had 2 settings... on and off. My friend and I were constantly fiddling with it because it was too cold, then too hot, etc...
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: The bathroom was average sized with all the standard amenities. Just like the room the bathroom was very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent night stay - quick and comfortable

reviews.text: I saw several complaints on Trip Advisor about the noise from the outside bar. The hotel appears to have fixed that problem. I had a room right over the pool and bar and it appears that the outside area closes at 10PM now.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.text: Upon first impressions, I thought I had chosen a nice hotel to stay in. The lobby and grounds were clean, check-in was quick, and the overall atmosphere seemed to be a good one. These feelings took a turn for the worse as I entered my 7th floor room. After a week of temperatures topping 100 degrees, I figured the air conditioners would be cracked to the max and I'd enjoy a cool and relaxing evening while working from my laptop before Monday and Tuesday's meetings. The room was so humid and warm that I was forced to go to the lobby to spend a good deal of my afternoon working from there -- distracted by strangers but at least not pouring sweat. I made the front desk aware of the issue and they said they'd send someone up to check it out. The next two days/nights were spent in an uncomfortably warm room. I am not one to complain, so I dealt with it; however, what I found in my bathroom the last night was unacceptable.
reviews.title: Uncomfortable and unsanitary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reaching for a tissue -- kept on the lower shelf of the vanity -- I noticed something lying on the floor beneath. It was a soiled pad from some woman's "time of month." How this was overlooked for two full days now is beyond me, since I am a male and it certainly isn't mine. I snapped a picture of it with my phone and proceeded to the lobby to have them send someone to clean it. I didn't care for a new room or anything (not that it was offered to me), since it was getting late and I was checking out first thing anyway. They sent someone up 10 minutes later to grab the pad and head out on his way. Later that night, I ventured to the vending area on the floor to grab some ice for my water. To my dismay, sitting on top of the garbage in the vending area was the pad removed from my room! (I have a picture of this also)
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Like I mentioned before, I'm not one to complain, but this entire situation made me very uncomfortable. I wondered if they might call me to apologize or credit my room or something, but nothing was ever done. I checked out in the morning and was somewhat angered when I saw that I paid almost $400 for two nights of heat and unsanitary findings. Later in the morning after checkout, I wrote customer service, explaining my situation and how unsatisfying it truly was. A week later, management at the hotel reaches out to me, asking to enroll me in "Priority Club." Maybe this would be of value to me if I traveled more often, but I don't. When I do travel, its for work and everything is expensed, so it really has little value to me. When I went to redeem the points they added to my membership, I discovered that 5,000 points will earn me a DVD copy of the CaddyShack - a $5 value. Really?! I'm not looking for a hand-out, but I am also not looking for a slap in the face. This experience truly has changed my impression of this hotel group, and I hope to avoid them in the future.
reviews.title: fourth stay in 13 months. Great for business trips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will keep the two pictures mentioned above to myself (they have already been sent to hotel mgmt) only because I don't want to ruin anybody's breakfast.
reviews.title: Maybe if we had a different room......................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the room in the hotel based on Trip Advisor's ratings. We were not disappointed. The location was very convenient but still away from the major highway (unusual for a Holiday Inn), staff was utterly professional, the common areas, as well as, our room were spotless and comfortable.
reviews.title: Located in a commercial area, limited services within walking distance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last week for two nights choosing this one for it's affordable price as we were on the road and actually decided to stay another night so we could see the sights in DC. It was in a nice spacious lot with some office buildings scattered around, it seemed to be a safe neighborhood not a lot of people wandering around. The lobby was OK not a long walk to the elevator it was right there. There's a coffeee/hot chocolate machine in lobby free all day, good perk, no free breakfast. The restaurant closes early but bar stays open, we didn't eat there but it looked ok. The room was good and as people said was slightly worn but not old and you get more toiletries than a lot of other HIE's nowadays. Nice size fridge and small perfect microwave in the room, and lots of outlets to plug your cell (on bedstands on lamp base). There was some spottiness under our sink which upon further inspection did not rub off,.... fine for me. It is a very good place too stay if you can't afford the more expensive ones in DC and have a car because it is around 10 mins or so drive into DC. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Good hotel worth the money.

reviews.text: This is the second worst Holiday Inn I've ever stayed! Everything that can be wrong in a hotel was wrong! Dirty carpet, hair in the bathroom, noisy refrigerator, noisy guests, bad service..... Never again!
reviews.title: Dirty, noisy, bad service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 10 days in late July / early Aug 2011. The rooms have been remodled and are updated with flat screen tvs, dark chocolate furnishings, new carpet and bedding, etc. Ours came with a microwave and fridge along with a coffee maker. The hotel offered free wi-fi, which worked well. And this hotel is convientently located, near multiple innerstates, including the BWI parkway. Now for why it could be a star: BETTER MANAGEMENT. We arrived at 5pm the day of our check-in and our room wasn't ready. We waited for almost 2 hours before we were given a room. In the meantime, someone came to the desk and said a man entered her room with "his" key, thinking it was the room he'd been assigned...weird. The front desk has no idea which rooms are available, they literally left the desk twice to physically check the rooms to see if they were vacant, cleaned, etc. When we finally did get our room key, that room wasn't cleaned, mind you it was after 7pm at this point. We were assigned another room, but that key didn't work! So after multiple trips to the front desk, we finally made it to a clean room. Now, clean is putting it lightly. The hotel service basically sanitizes the bathroom and changes the sheets - that's it! And the service may not even come until after 5pm daily.
reviews.title: Could be a star

reviews.text: There is a on site resturant / bar which has decent prices and good drinks but the place if very dirty. We actually asked for cloth napkins to cover the table we were sitting at because it was so grimey. So again, if the place had better management, both in the hotel and resturant, it could be a star. However it is the one of the cheapest hotels in town and has a shuttle to the nearest metro station, although we never used it. The hotel was sold out for our entire stay so obviously it's not that bad but after 10 days, the inept service really started to bug me!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel. Modern, clean rooms and lobby. Comfortable linen. Allowed us to check in and out at 2:00. Plenty of parking. Shuttle to Meto every half our. Friendly helpful staff.
reviews.title: could do better

reviews.text: Very nice, clean property that provides convenient access to downtown DC at a very reasonable cost. The shuttle service to Metro is a nice amenity and the hotel had a very friendly and helpful staff. As from someone travels to the DC-area often this is a nice alternative to the overly expensive hotels located within DC.
reviews.title: Clean & Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, our room was clean and nice. A typical hotel room. The mattress was not overly comfortable. The property was well kept. It was quiet and convenient to travel into DC. Restaurants, Gas Stations and stores very close by. Check in and out was very convenient.
reviews.title: Quiet & Convenient

reviews.text: For any of you traveling either up north or in the Metro area, this Holiday Inn is so convenience, right off the BWI Parkway. From DC it’s only 20 min away and to Baltimore, MD just 25 min. as for the rooms the Hotel has gone through a great deal of renovations, new flat screen TV’s, bedding and updated bathrooms, what else would you ask for, it’s all here, take my word for it.
reviews.title: Det. Miranda, M - Location of Hotel and Rooms

reviews.text: The hotel has seen some better days. They worked on updating the rooms. The internet is terrible. If internet is important to you. Do not stay here. We have stayed here several times due to Priceline winning bid. If it was not for Priceline, I would not stay here. The best thing about the Hotel is the hot chocolate in the lobby.
reviews.title: OK place to stay

reviews.text: Late arrival, early departure, pretty good breakfast. The government crowd dominates the clientele. The building is a bit stale, but functional. Walls in my room on first floor were paper thin (I thought the guest next door was coughing in my ear at 3:00 am, when he was clearly not!). A functional stay but I really wouldn't go out of my way to stay here in future.
reviews.title: Average stay in the belt...

reviews.text: Kind of dark and old feeling and no benefits for being a PC member. However probably the best price for a major chain that close to DC. The bar area is a lot of fun but the food was only so-so. I stay here often for work mostly because of the price.
reviews.title: Not the Best

reviews.text: My daughter had major surgery at a local hospital and we stayed here for 13 nights. It was our home away from home. The hotel staff was fabulous and very caring. A huge thank you to the front desk staff: Chris, Val, John, Daniel, Jack, Rod and Efrem - amazing people. We can't thank them enough for how kind they were to us during our stay. We were there the two weeks before Christmas and the hotel lobby had a beautiful Christmas tree with a fireplace going. A nice place to retreat to after a long day at the hospital. The maid service was excellent too - they were there when we needed them but respected our privacy too as my daughter recovered from her surgery. It was great to have a washer/dryer available to us during our stay. Thank you everyone for your great service!
reviews.title: Staff and service was excellent! Thank you!

reviews.text: The hotel was nice and clean. Perfect location. The restaurant was nice and the food was good. I was excited to see there was a bar area that had multiple TV's and was willing to change one of them to a game I was looking for. My only complain would be the music. In such an urban area and what seemed to be fun bar the music was outdated, slow, and depressing. I asked about changing the music but was advised that the hotel managment demands that it must be the music that was on or no music at all. I wasn't looking for club music or anything heavy, just a little more contemporary to match the atmosphere. On a good note, the chesapeake wings were the best wings I have ever had!
reviews.title: Liven up

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Awesome Place to Stay in DC - a Blessing!
Cheers
reviews.text: - Extremely helpful and kind desk staff.

Thank you bartender Roxann for cheering me up during the holidays when I'm away from home. The bar & lobby were clean & beautifully decorated for the holidays. Very helpful & friendly staff at this hotel!
reviews.title: Fun atmosphere with friendly staff

reviews.text: I needed to visit DC, but didn't want to stay in the city. Location was excellent - not too far from I-295/I-95/Rt50. The lobby was appointed nicely, and the rooms were way more than I expected from a Holiday Inn. Bed was very comfortable, and the furniture was very modern and clean. Staff was friendly. Would definitely stay again if I needed to be in the area.
reviews.title: Really good value

reviews.text: good food &ex service with warn welcome by joseph lewis even u on a bussines u having fun
reviews.title: nice hotel famiy atmustfair great staff they are asome joseph on bar eric on the floor and mis spencer golden hands

reviews.text: makes u feel like home............keep on with the good job.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: il be back for sure .
reviews.title: Nice place big room

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a one-night stay before an admitted students event at the Univ. of Maryland. I booked mostly based on price and proximity. Front desk staff members were friendly and welcoming. The room was fine and the beds seemed to be newer, although the walls were pretty thin. Bathroom was tiny, but had been updated. The heater/AC unit was older and so noisy and hard to control (too hot!) that we turned it off--might be a bigger issue in summer, but we were fine with it off in colder weather. Be warned that the breakfast buffet is NOT included in the rate, even though the offerings look like the usual free breakfast spread found in Holiday Inn Express and other similar hotel chains. This was not marked clearly anywhere and there was no one around the dining room to ask when we arrived, so we ended up paying $21 for 2 people for a very mediocre breakfast, and we hardly ate anything. Another guest also didn't realize it wasn't included, grabbed a box of cereal, milk, and coffee, and went back to his room--the hotel really needs to make the price clear somewhere or have someone stationed at the front of the dining room at peak times. We wouldn't have eaten there if we'd known the price ahead of time. Go to the Silver Diner instead! Wifi was free but very slow and I ended up not using it much based on the slow speed. If my son enrolls at UMD we might return based solely on price, but I will look for deals elsewhere, too. It might be cheaper to find a hotel that has slightly higher rates but includes breakfast.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced, but some issues

reviews.text: The Greenbelt Holiday Inn is a great place to stay, once you figure where it is located. There are plenty of places to have dinner and shopping centers close by.
reviews.title: Nice place tp Stay, Once you figure out How to get around

reviews.text: The freeway entrance to both Baltimore and Washington DC are very near, as long as you know which one to take.
reviews.title: Great value, safe area close to University of Maryland

reviews.text: The staff is very professional and the house keeping staff was very thoughtful and very good.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL AND STAFF

reviews.text: Although the walls were kind of thin, so you can hear the guest next door.
reviews.title: Willy K rest/bar makes the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the 7th floor, it was was great, very quiet, pool closed at 9pm so there wasn't any comotion down in the bar area. I had read that it was very noisy at nite, and I suppose if you stayed on the lower floors and on poolside, you might get some noisey people. When we got to our room it was imaculate. The bed was very comfortable, the room had an easy chair with an ottoman, very nice..........a desk, small micro,and fridge. The staff was more than nice, your treated like they've known you forever. Donald......what can I say, the nicest gentleman, the shuttle drivers were great too. I can't say enough about how enjoyable they made our vacation stay. It's alittle out of the way from DC, but it was definetly worth it. A friend stayed at a hotle in the city, and had to pay a daily parking fee. Plenty of places to eat, Chevy's has great mexican food, and it's very close.
reviews.title: We really enjoyed our stay, we'll be back !!

reviews.text: Close to metro stations close to fedex field. Nice staff very friendly.
reviews.title: Useful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend trip. We checked in around 1pm but they didn't have any rooms ready so we had to wait about 20 mins. It is what it is. When we did get our room, it was worth the wait. Very spacious and modern design. Clean and comfortable. The fridge and microwave were very handy for us to store some food and water. The bathroom was, shall we say, quaint. Not tiny by any means, but a little small. The shower curtains were short and did fully cover the entire tub so the floor got all wet when we showered. It was very weird that they didn't have longer curtains.
reviews.title: Great hotel with awesome staff

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a pretty nice area. There's a plaza within walking distance or a quick 2 min drive. It has a Safeway and stores (Dress Barn, Famous Footware, Payless to name a few). There's also a Wendy's, Denny's and Chevy's there too. Tons of free parking and free wi-fi. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating. I lost my room pass the first night and they gave me a replacement at no charge. The lady was like "we're all human and we lose things". She was really sweet. The cleaning staff were also really nice.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the place!

reviews.text: We didn't try the restaurant located in the lobby. The food didn't look to appetizing. For for $9.99 you can have and all you can eat breakfast. There's also free coffee available in the lobby.
reviews.title: Better than expected.

aka: Holiday Inn Washington Dc / Greenbelt Md Hotel Greenbelt
description: The Holiday Inn Washington, DC / Greenbelt completes multi-million dollar renovation! The newly renovated Holiday Inn Washington, DC / Greenbelt is a full-service hotel conveniently located near many government and corporate offices: NASA, Verizon, IRS, FDA, USDA, Lockheed Martin, the University of Maryland in College Park, and New Carrollton Amtrak and Greenbelt Metro stations are within 5 miles. Corporate guests will appreciate the free high-speed Internet, and fitness center. Leisure travelers staying at the Greenbelt hotel will enjoy visiting Six Flags America and the Greenway Center Shopping Center, plus the many attractions in nearby Washington, DC, Baltimore, and Annapolis. Sports enthusiasts will be convenient to FedEx Field - Washington Redskins, RFK Stadium - Washington Nationals and DC United, Verizon Center - Capitals, Wizards, and Mystics. At the newly renovated Holiday Inn Washington DC/Greenbelt, our service is outstanding and our accommodations are superb. Kids Eat Free in Willy K's, our comfortable and recently renovated restaurant and lounge. The Holiday Inn Washington, DC/Greenbelt offers two meeting rooms and is located adjacent to the Martin's Crosswinds Catering Facility.
